Data Fields
EDMA_channelConfig_t_ Struct Reference

Channel configuration. Specifies the full configuration for a DMA or QDMA channel with associated paramId and param Set configuration. More...

#include <drivers/edma/edma.h>

Data Fields

uint8_t channelType
 channelType can be either EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA or EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA
 
uint8_t qdmaParamTriggerWordOffset
 qdmaParamTriggerWordOffset represents the offset (0-7) of the PaRAM that is used when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA, use one of QDMA Trigger Word Offset Definitions for convenience of specifying which parameter in the Param is to be used as the trigger word.
 
uint8_t channelId
 0 to (EDMA_NUM_DMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA.
0 to (EDMA_NUM_QDMA_CHANNELS - 1) when channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_QDMA.
 
uint16_t paramId
 Id of the PaRAM set, valid range is from 0 to (N - 1), where N is the number of param sets in the EDMA's CC that is opened, must be identical to channelId for DMA channel (channelType is EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA) if channel mapping does not exist in the hardware.
 
uint8_t eventQueueId
 Id of the event queue in which the channel transfer request is submitted, valid range is from 0 to (Q - 1), where Q is the number of event queues in the EDMA's CC that is opened.
 
EDMA_paramSetConfig_t paramSetConfig
 configuration of the PaRAM set
 
EDMA_transferCompletionCallbackFxn_t transferCompletionCallbackFxn
 call back function for intermediate or final transfer completion depending on configuration of interrupt related flags in paramSetConfig. If NULL, it is assumed that the intent of the user is to poll for the completion of the transfer using EDMA_isTransferComplete.
 
uintptr_t transferCompletionCallbackFxnArg
 argument to be returned by the call back function transferCompletionCallbackFxn.
 

Detailed Description

Channel configuration. Specifies the full configuration for a DMA or QDMA channel with associated paramId and param Set configuration.
